description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Kanchanaburi" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Kanchanaburi

places.generalDescription: Erawan National Park is a renowned destination featuring tiered waterfalls, picturesque hiking trails, and opportunities for nature exploration and swimming. The park is home to the iconic Bridge over the Kwai River, a significant relic from World War II. Visitors can also pay their respects at the Kanchanaburi War Cemetery and admire the panoramic views from Wat Tham Sua temple.

sources.snippet: In the afternoon, we headed to Erawan National Park, home to the stunning seven-tiered Erawan Waterfall. The vibrant turquoise pools and lush surroundings invited us to explore, swim, and capture beautiful memories together. To round off the day, we dined at a floating restaurant, savoring fresh seafood and traditional Thai dishes while taking in the magical views of the river at night.
sources.shortName: Thailand Travel Review By Mr. And Mrs. Girard

sources.snippet: This National park is a home for some of nature’s most beautiful attractions. among them, there is one hotspot which is not only a Kanchanaburi attraction but also one of the most famous destinations in the itinerary of a Thailand vacation. Considered to be the most beautiful waterfall in Thailand this cascading beauty is a real treasure.
sources.shortName: What to do in Kanchanaburi? - Top 10 Attractions

sources.snippet: This national park is famous for its unique waterfalls, with a total of 7 levels of water flowing down from the top of the mountain. These waterfalls are numbered from 1 to 7 and are named after the seven-headed dragon in Thai legend. Each level of the waterfall has its own unique characteristics and beauty.
sources.shortName: Kanchanaburi Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Drive 1 hour and 7 mins to Erawan National Park, home to majestic emerald ponds and waterfalls. There are 7 tiers to the waterfall, the first two being easy to get to and the rest for the more… Athletic inclined couples. (You can lounge in the waterfall pool too!)
sources.shortName: 5D4N Bangkok+Kanchanaburi Itinerary for couples: Stay in a romantic floating resort, go glamping, stargazing, shopping and more

sources.snippet: 45 km from city center 9 out of 20 Things To Do in Kanchanaburi. Highlights: Erawan Waterfall. This is the national park of the highest waterfall in Thailand and resembles the three-headed elephant, Erawan.
sources.shortName: 20 Things to do in Kanchanaburi Thailand 2025

sources.snippet: Housing one of the most famous waterfalls in the country, Erawan National Park boasts stunning scenery where over 80% is covered in mixed deciduous, dipterocarps and evergreen forests.
sources.shortName: Things to Do Kanchanaburi

sources.snippet: From the iconic Bridge over the River Kwai to the stunning waterfalls of Erawan National Park, Kanchanaburi offers couples a chance to enjoy a romantic and adventurous getaway.
sources.shortName: Romantic Tour In Kanchanaburi
Kanchanaburi things to do more than the Bridge on the River Kwai

places.name: Erawan National Park

reviews.text:
Amazing place, loved trekking here. The water is cold which feels amazing in the scorching sun.It is definitely a must-visit for nature lovers and adventure seekers. The 7-tier waterfall of just 2000m makes for a fun and manageable trek, and the cool, clear water is a perfect reward after the hike to the top. But, nothing beats a refreshing dip in those emerald like pools on a hot summer day.
The well-maintained & nicely laid out paths and stairs also make it accessible for most people, though the higher levels can still be a bit of a challenge for some.

Walking up the waterfalls in Erawan National Park was one of the most beautiful expeditions I did in Thailand. Everything is well maintained, and it was not too crowded.
Even though I didn't see any monkeys, some signs were warning about monkeys that might try to steal some belongings at some parts.
You will find endlessly beautiful sceneries to make pictures and video clips.
Don't think. Just go and enjoy.

A great place to visit for a hike and swim. Wear good water shoes and dress light. If you want some intense exercise go to waterfall floor 7 first then come down and visit the other waterfall pools. Hike isn't challenging for average people but it does have steep sections, you climb up to 700 metres I believe.

places.address: 94GV+5HW, Tha Kradan, Si Sawat District, Kanchanaburi 71250, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Keeree Mantra Kanchanaburi is a top dining destination in Kanchanaburi, offering traditional Thai cuisine in a picturesque natural setting. The restaurant's expansive open-air layout provides stunning views of the surrounding mountains and lake. Signature dishes like coconut milk fish curry and pineapple fried rice are highly recommended. Adjacent to the restaurant is Village Farm To Cafe, a modern wooden cafe with mountain views and delectable treats like melon cream chocolate bun and green melon frozen yogurt.

sources.snippet: If you're looking for a cool dining experience, Keeree Mantra Restaurant is a must-visit place. It is a popular spot for locals, tourists, and travelers. Chill in the cool breeze, relax on a large bean bag, and enjoy the stunning view while sipping a drink.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Kanchanaburi Attractions 2024

sources.snippet: Keeree Manta is a sister restaurant of Keere Tara restaurant. Situated on the motorway to Myanmar, this one has piqued our interest.
sources.shortName: 31 Incredible things to do in and around Kanchanaburi
Kanchanaburi things to do more than the Bridge on the River Kwai
33 Amazing things to do in Kanchanaburi, Thailand

places.name: Keeree Mantra Kanchanaburi

reviews.text:
Had a wonderful lunch today at Keeree Mantra Restaurant.
The view was stunning and the atmosphere was truly relaxing.
The restroom was clean, and the staff were polite and provided excellent service.
This place is also perfect for hosting events or even weddings.
Most importantly, every dish was fresh, clean, and absolutely delicious. Highly recommended!

Large area, great view and lots of seats and tables both indoor with AC and outdoor. Great place for family, friends, couple or work trip. Plenty of parking.

Cafe is spacious and serves variety of drinks and cakes. Great food with good taste.

Tucked in the middle of nowhere, this restaurant is highly recommended if you are nearby. The food was authentic and tasted really good. And the place is huge!

Pineapple rice had a special spice added to it.
The cabbage although looked simple, it was well seasoned.
The fried veggie was served with a really good unique sauce.
The otah was out of the world. Only wish the fish was in the middle of the pot rather than the bottom.
The coconut lime seafood soup was more sour unlike the usual milk coconut base.
The river snail with veggies was also good. The curry had a spicy punch to it.
Dessert was preserved mango which is apparently very hard to find even in Thailand!

places.address: 88/8 ม.4 ถ.แสงชูโต, Nong Bua, Mueang Kanchanaburi District, Kanchanaburi 71190, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Keeree Tara is a casual restaurant that offers classic Thai dishes and stunning views of the famous River Kwai Bridge. Located about 10 minutes' drive from the bridge, it provides an idyllic setting surrounded by a vast green lawn. Popular menu items include coconut milk fish curry, pineapple fried rice, tom yum, and cappuccino. Next to Keeree Tara is The Village Farm To Cafe, a modern wooden cafe nestled among mountains with a bamboo tunnel for leisurely strolls.

sources.snippet: If you're a fan of delicious food, dining at Keeree Tara Restaurant is a must. This riverside restaurant offers a romantic ambiance and serves delicious Thai cuisine, making it the perfect spot for a cozy dinner by the water.
sources.shortName: Thailand Travel Review By Mr. And Mrs. Girard

places.name: Keeree Tara

reviews.text: I like this place and the location, the first time I went there was during covid and it was super calm with not many customers yet the food was fresh and tasty. then I went with my friends and family and the experience didn't change. their food is authentic and the view is astonishing, but what really stands out is the service. highly recommended.

This is an affordable “high-so” ( high society) Thai food restaurant by the river . The Kuan Im temple is across the river ..
bridge over river Kwai insight too.

The menu is extensive.   Couldn't decide what to eat

Came alone
Ordered Isan pork sausage starter ..
duck curry n omelette … n coconut drink

Oh no. I ordered too much for one person ..
the portion is generous . Could not finish all . Oh no
The food is delicious!!!!

The duck curry is unique … there are grapes in the curry .

Live bassa nova music so good
The singer can sing very very well !!

A very unique restaurant by the waterfront. Perfect for a date or family gathering. This place is usually packed but we came on a Tuesday night and it is a lot less crowded. The food is delightful and the service is excellent. Top notch.

places.address: 431, 1 River Kwai Rd, Ban Tai, Mueang Kanchanaburi District, Kanchanaburi 71000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Mueang Sing Historical Park, situated in Kanchanaburi, Thailand, is a fascinating archaeological site that showcases the remains of an ancient Khmer temple complex dating back to the 13th century. The park features well-preserved ruins of two ancient Khmer temples and a burial site where prehistoric skeletons were discovered.

sources.snippet: On our last full day in Kanchanaburi, we will take the scooter for another spin with a morning visit at Prasat Mueang Sing Historical Park, a historic Khmer-era temple and burial site where several well-preserved skeletons were found, dating back even before the Khmer reign of the area. There is not a whole lot to see except the main temple with the gate still standing and the burial ground where they discovered the remains of prehistoric people who lived here long before the Khmer Empire reign. But since it is on the way, we might as well stop by to take some photos.
sources.shortName: Discover Kanchanaburi: 17 Epic Things to See and Do

sources.snippet: Recommended places to visit in Kanchanaburi are Srinakharin Dam, Vajiralongkorn Dam, Sai Yok Noi Waterfall, Sai Yok Yai Waterfall, Erawan Waterfall, Mon Bridge, Mueang Sing Historical Park, Three Pagodas Pass, Wat Wang Wiwekaram, Underwater City, the Bridge of the River Kwae, Kanchanaburi War Cemetery, and World War II Museum and Art Gallery.
sources.shortName: The official website of Tourism Authority of Thailand

places.name: Mueang Sing Historical Park

reviews.text: Mueang Sing Historical Park is a peaceful retreat. Even during peak holidays Even though there are many tourists But the atmosphere remains calm and relaxed. The park is large and you can drive around. To easily explore the ruins If you don't want It's a great place to enjoy history and nature in a more peaceful setting without the usual crowds. So this perfect place for a quiet retreat to see and enjoy all the attractions with a good weather.
Beautiful & interesting. We had a fantastic time visiting this site.  Reminded me of Siem Reap. Went weekdays & no other people was there.  I'm surprised that it wasn't a bit more busy.

This place is massive and they charge extras for a taxi entering- my friend and I were lucky enough to tip 100 baht for the grab driver to wait for us for 2 hours as the grab driver said that it wasn't very crowded on a Saturday afternoon at 2pm and they would not be able to find another customer on the way back. The park was good for a nice walk and checking out sights and there is lush greenery and ruins around. Do bring bug spray as I had to use it every hour to keep the bugs from my shoulders and legs!

places.address: 26QV+GCJ, อุทยานประวัติศาสตร์ปราสาทเมืองสิงห์, Sing, Sai Yok District, Kanchanaburi 71150, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Thewa Sangkharam, located in Kanchanaburi city along the Kwai river, hosts the Suk Jai Floating Market once a week. Despite its name, it's more of a night market and doesn't actually have sellers on boats. The temple site is extensive with numerous statues and temples to explore, including a Royal Monastery and a fascinating museum showcasing the history of a monk who rose to become the supreme leader of the Buddhists.

sources.snippet: Was There Sangkharam is a very large area with many statues, temples and Buddha's allow over an hour as there is much beauty to see and snacks to try.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaway in Kanchanaburi: A Walking Tour ใน Kanchanaburi
Romantic Getaway in Kanchanaburi: A Walking Tour in Kanchanaburi

places.name: Wat Thewa Sangkharam

reviews.text:
We visited this temple on 11 May 2025. It s Vesak Day and International Mother's Day today.

Temple area is peaceful. Well maintained and clean. Lots of car park spaces.

Very beautiful and very big temple located near the River Kwai. Very well kept temple grounds and the dogs here are used to people as the temple also share ground with a local school. Definitely worth a visit.
Pretty place and it makes for nice photos. We walked past it on our way to the Skywalk bridge.

places.address: Ban Nuea, Mueang Kanchanaburi District, Kanchanaburi 71000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: River Khwae Bridge, also known as the Death Railway, is a historic bridge and rail line constructed by prisoners of war during World War II. It has gained notoriety through its association with the movie 'River Kwai Bridge' and is a key tourist attraction in Kanchanaburi. Visitors can explore the area's harrowing past by visiting important World War II sites such as the Allied War Cemetery, Thailand-Burma Railway Center, and Hellfire Pass.

sources.snippet: It is best known for its World War II history and the key tourist spots associated with it, such as the Death Railway, the River Kwai Bridge (made famous by the movie River Kwai Bridge), and the Allied War Cemetery. recommended places to visit in Kanchanaburi are Srinakarin Dam, Vajiralongkorn Dam, Sai Yok Noi Waterfall, Sai Yok Yai Waterfall, Erawan Waterfall, Mon Bridge, Mueang Sing Historical Park, Three Pagodas Pass, Wat Wang Wiwekaram, Underwater City, the Bridge of the River Kwai, Kanchanaburi War Cemetery, and World War II museum and Art Gallery.
sources.shortName: Top Things To Do In Kanchanaburi and where to stay

sources.snippet: The third-class train service operates twice a day, with morning train No. 257 departing at 07.50 and arriving at Kanchanaburi at 10.25, the River Kwai Bridge at 10.42, and the Namtok Station at 12.35. Afternoon train No. 259 departs at 13.55 and arrives at Kanchanaburi at 16.24, the River Kwai Bridge at 16.33, and the Waterfall Station at 18.30 hrs.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Kanchanaburi Attractions 2024

sources.snippet: Most tourists stay at Maenamkwai Road, it’s the busiest area with the most hostels, guesthouses and restaurants and close to the river and the bridge. Like in any other more or less touristy place there are hundreds of accommodation options on any budget. Here are some places with the best ratings;
sources.shortName: 33 Amazing things to do in Kanchanaburi, Thailand

sources.snippet: Kanchanaburi scenic spots can't begin without its iconic landmark - the River Kwai Bridge. Millions of tourists have visited this spot to connect with its history and click some beautiful photos. During my visit, there was hardly anyone here due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
sources.shortName: 11 Scenic Spots in Kanchanaburi

sources.snippet: Take a leisurely stroll along the iconic River Kwai Bridge, visit the historic Hellfire Pass, or embark on a romantic boat ride along the River Kwai.
sources.shortName: Romantic Tour In Kanchanaburi
Glamping tented camp in Kanchanaburi

places.name: RIVER KWAI BRIDGE

reviews.text: The bridge was nice to admire the view, there are train tracks on the bridge where trains pass by here and there. There are clothes and food stands near the bridge because they know tourists come there. If you want a quick place to visit for like 30- 60 minutes, nice place to visit. I booked a package that took us here, animal park and cafe all in one day.

This place is a very scenic area, the river, the green hills in the background, and the old trains make it great for photos. You can walk across the bridge but just watch out for the tourist train that occasionally comes through.
There are lots of food stalls, coffee shops, and souvenir stores around, so it's easy to spend an hour here. I visited around 2 PM, it was not too hot, and the light was beautiful.

A meaningful and memorable place to visit! The River Kwai Bridge is rich in history, and walking across it really brings the past to life. You can feel the significance of the site while enjoying the beautiful views of the river.

The breeze in the middle of the bridge is surprisingly refreshing - a perfect spot to pause, take in the scenery, and reflect.

Whether you're into history, photography, or just want to enjoy a peaceful riverside atmosphere, this landmark is worth the stop. Plenty of local vendors and cafes nearby too!

places.address: River Kwai Rd, Tha Ma Kham, Mueang Kanchanaburi District, Kanchanaburi 71000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Kanchanaburi, the Kanchanaburi War Cemetery serves as a solemn tribute to over 6,000 Commonwealth and Dutch soldiers who tragically lost their lives while forced to construct the infamous Burma-Siam railway during World War II. This beautifully maintained cemetery features lush gardens and manicured lawns, creating a serene environment for visitors to reflect on the immense sacrifices made by these courageous individuals.

sources.snippet: One can see the extent of cruelness and inhumane acts of World War II, at this War Cemetery which is where over 7000 prisoners of war who were enslaved to work on the construction of the Death Railways, are buried. Except for the prisoners of  America (sent to their homeland), people of other nationalities (Asians, Australia, British and Dutch) have all been buried here through allied agreement. Maintained by the Commonwealth War Graves Commission, this memoir is maintained very well and with dignity.
sources.shortName: What to do in Kanchanaburi? - Top 10 Attractions

sources.snippet: Recommended places to visit in Kanchanaburi are Srinakharin Dam, Vajiralongkorn Dam, Sai Yok Noi Waterfall, Sai Yok Yai Waterfall, Erawan Waterfall, Mon Bridge, Mueang Sing Historical Park, Three Pagodas Pass, Wat Wang Wiwekaram, Underwater City, the Bridge of the River Kwae, Kanchanaburi War Cemetery, and World War II Museum and Art Gallery.
sources.shortName: The official website of Tourism Authority of Thailand

sources.snippet: 14 km from city center 7 out of 20 Things To Do in Kanchanaburi. The Kanchanaburi War Cemetary is the larger of Kanchanaburi's two war cemeteries and is adjacent to the Saeng Chuto Road. Out of 6982 prisoners of war (POWs) buried here, nearly half were British; the rest came mainly from Australia and the Netherlands.
sources.shortName: 20 Things to do in Kanchanaburi Thailand 2025

sources.snippet: The Kanchanaburi War Cemetery is the main prisoner of war (POW) cemetery for victims of Japanese imprisonment while building the Burma Railway. It is on the main road, Saeng Chuto Road, through the town of Kanchanaburi, Thailand, adjacent to an older Chinese cemetery.
sources.shortName: Romantic Getaway in Kanchanaburi: A Walking Tour ใน Kanchanaburi
Romantic Getaway in Kanchanaburi: A Walking Tour in Kanchanaburi

places.name: Kanchanaburi War Cemetery (DonRak)

reviews.text:
The most moving place of remembrance I've ever been to

In the UK we remember those who lost their lives in wars, usually thinking they were shot or died of wounds. Never do we think of British personnel as tortured or dying of heat stroke/malaria or starvation from being Prisoners of War

This should never have happened

Kanchanaburi War Cemetery is a significant historical site that honors the thousands of Allied prisoners of war (POWs) who perished while constructing the Thai-Burma Railway during World War II. Located in the heart of Kanchanaburi, the cemetery is the final resting place for over 6,000 soldiers, primarily from the United Kingdom, Australia, and the Netherlands. The meticulously maintained grounds, with rows of neatly arranged headstones, create a solemn yet peaceful atmosphere. Each headstone bears the name, rank, and regiment of the fallen, offering visitors a personal connection to the immense human cost of war.
The cemetery is not just a place of remembrance but also an important historical landmark. It is located near the Death Railway Museum, which provides deeper insights into the brutal conditions faced by the POWs during the railway's construction. Visiting the site evokes a deep sense of respect and reflection, as it reminds us of the resilience and sacrifices of those who suffered. The quiet, well-kept surroundings make it a place of contemplation, where visitors can pay their respects.
For history enthusiasts or those wishing to honor the memory of the fallen, the Kanchanaburi War Cemetery is a must-visit destination. It stands as a powerful tribute to the past, ensuring that the stories of those who lost their lives are never forgotten.

The Kanchanaburi War Cemetery is a solemn, well-maintained, and deeply moving place. It's not about grandeur but about memory-lined with headstones that represent individual stories and sacrifices. Visitors often describe it as a quiet space that prompts reflection and gratitude. Pairing it with the railway museum across the street makes for a balanced and meaningful visit. If you value thoughtful, emotional travel, I'd highly recommend making time for this.
The cemetery holds nearly 7,000 graves-mainly British, Australian, and Dutch POWs from the Burma Railway. It also includes ashes of victims from a cholera outbreak and a memorial for those whose graves couldn't be maintained elsewhere.

places.address: 284/66 Sangchuto Rd, Ban Tai, Mueang Kanchanaburi District, Kanchanaburi 71000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Rock Valley Hot Springs and Fish Spa is a popular destination located about an hour's drive northeast of Kanchanaburi city in Thailand. It is often visited on day trips from the city and offers a relaxing experience with hot springs and fish spa treatments. The area also boasts beautiful waterfalls, raft houses, stunning landscapes, river views, and ancient ruins to explore. While it may be challenging to reach by car, visitors can enjoy the various pools available for a fee.

sources.snippet: Beside World War II and national parks, the province has beautiful waterfalls, raft house, magnification landscape & interesting river views and Cambodian ancient ruin. This is a recommended Thailand tour especially for those who have a limited schedule while in Thailand.
sources.shortName: Kanchanaburi things to do more than the Bridge on the River Kwai

sources.snippet: Get a move on because it’s 20 minutes to River Kwai Village Hotel, and you’ll need to take a boat from here to the spa. There are 15 different hot springs you two can try, but the full body mud mask will definitely make for good memories.
sources.shortName: 5D4N Bangkok+Kanchanaburi Itinerary for couples: Stay in a romantic floating resort, go glamping, stargazing, shopping and more

places.name: Rock Valley Hot Springs and Fish Spa

reviews.text: This place is a must-visit! They offer 15 different herbal pool spas with an entrance fee of 650 baht, along with a variety of additional massage and spa services available for an extra charge. There are two ways to access the area: by boat or via a local road, which, though unpaved, is still accessible. I highly recommend coming by car to ensure you have plenty of time to relax and enjoy your visit. The facilities are very clean, and the service is excellent!

It was a super experience! There are 15 baths with milk, wine, and coffee of different temperatures. It's just magical! the entrance fee is 650 baht, you can get a massage for an additional price. They give you bathing suits, you can't wear your own swimsuit.

15 pools to relax in and soak away life's stresses!
If you drive, the road in is very rough so take care.
We went late afternoon and it was very tranquil and enjoyable having most pools to ourselves. However, when it's busy I think it wouldn't be so enjoyable and maybe a squeeze to get in some pools🫤.

places.address: River Kwai Village Hotel, Wang Krachae, Sai Yok District, Kanchanaburi 71150, Thailand

sources.snippet: Additional fees or charges may apply for optional activities, such as entrance fees or meals not included in the tour price. It is important to check the tour price breakdown and payment details for any exclusions or surcharges to avoid unexpected expenses.
sources.shortName: Romantic Tour In Kanchanaburi

places.name: Meals n' Bites @ JP's

reviews.text:
What a great little restaurant with authenic Thai dishes.
We ordered four different dishes and everything was delicious but the Cashew Chicken was something else and one of the best I have had in Thailand.
The owners are very nice and the price is great.
Will be back before I leave Kanchanaburi.

Edit: we came back and this time tried the Chicken in green curry and Coconut and the honey glazed Chicken and we ordered the Cashew Chicken again of course.
It was just like before everything was delicious.
They remembered that we like our dishes spicy and made the green curry more spicy and brought some extra chili to the table.
Thank you again 👌
Really good and affordable food. The owner is super friendly as well. Totally recommend!

Simple little eatery with absolutely delicious food. We ate around 6 different dishes here over a few days and every one of them was super tasty. Lovely little family of Jeff, Aoy (chef) and little JP looked after us really well. Highly recommended !

places.address: 316/3 River Kwai Rd, Ban Tai, Mueang Kanchanaburi District, Kanchanaburi 71000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Dheva Mantra Resort in Kanchanaburi offers an upscale colonial-style retreat with a range of amenities. The resort is located in the historical district, close to attractions like the Bridge Over the River Kwai and Kanchanaburi Walking Street. Guests can enjoy riverside dining, a saltwater pool, and a full-service spa offering massages and body treatments. The resort also features an outdoor pool, sauna, and fitness center for recreational activities.

sources.snippet: If you’re tired from busy and bustling cities and would like to be somewhere in a quiet in-nature place there are several great options around Kanchanaburi where you can enjoy the tranquility and spend a couple of days relaxing away from the city noises.
sources.shortName: 33 Amazing things to do in Kanchanaburi, Thailand

places.name: Dheva Mantra Resort

reviews.text:
Colonial style resort with great view and located on riverside. Quiet so great for relaxing holiday. Large area with garden full of great smell flowers.

A large swimming pool with seats for relaxing and sunbathing. Swimwear is a must here so be prepared.

Spacious room with comfy bed and great garden view. Toilet with a shower booth and  bath so you can choose. Perforated design of toilet's door looks great and serves its ventilating purpose  however it could give you a bit uncomfortable when doing your own business in there as people in the room can hear everything, could see your bottom half.

Food was good and various, staff was great and welcoming.

Overall, this was a very nice resort. The rooms were spacious, the employees were very friendly, and the pool was beautiful. It was very scenic, meaning it was quiet and relaxed. However, once you were at the hotel, you really did not have an option to leave the hotel. The included meals were not bad at all either. The only real negative was the constant presence of bugs within the room. We understood it would have been difficult to have it any other way, but it kept us from being 100% comfortable. Oh and the spa and associated services were quite affordable and an added bonus after a long day.

Resort is very big. Very beautiful resort. But they don't maintain. Their service also not good.
1. The day we checked in they asked us to have breakfast at the room. They can't provide buffet breakfast at the restaurant. When I told the staff at the lobby that "being a 4 or 5 star hotel they should maintain the standard", the  lady staff talked with me very rudely.
On the next day they were supposed to provide us the breakfast to the room at 8.00 am but until 8.12 they didn't give us any breakfast. After I call to the room service then they give us the breakfast. The staff who brought the breakfast to the room he told us that they were not informed about the breakfast.
2. Toilet flash was not working 😕
3. The lamps of the room were very dusty. I think they don't clean at all.
4. Very beautiful swimming pool but They don't maintain the swimming pool either. The water was very dirty.

This is a very beautiful resort with zero  maintenance.

places.address: 9, 99 Tambon ซอย 5, Tambon Tha Ma Kham, Mueang Kanchanaburi District, Kanchanaburi 71000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: River Kwai Canoe Travel offers a variety of options for tourists to explore the scenic river and its surroundings. The Maenamkwai Road area is popular for accommodation, providing easy access to the river and the famous bridge. Visitors can enjoy kayaking experiences, with options for different trip lengths and friendly local guides who ensure a smooth and enjoyable journey. The canoe trips allow travelers to immerse themselves in stunning natural scenery, encounter wildlife, and interact with welcoming locals along the way.

sources.snippet: After the busy buzz of Thailand’s capital, the pleasant vibe of Mae Nam Kwae Road along the River Kwai is just what a traveler needs. The stretch that parallels the river is crammed with guesthouses, cafes and bars for eating and socializing.
sources.shortName: 12 Best Things to Do in Kanchanaburi, Thailand

sources.snippet: From the iconic Bridge over the River Kwai to the stunning waterfalls of Erawan National Park, Kanchanaburi offers couples a chance to enjoy a romantic and adventurous getaway.
sources.shortName: Romantic Tour In Kanchanaburi

places.name: River Kwai Canoe Travel

reviews.text:
If you're looking for a flexible, independent activity without the constraints of a group or guide, this is the perfect option.

We rented two kayaks, and the experience was fantastic from start to finish. The woman running the service was incredibly kind and welcoming-she even offered us free bottled water before taking us to the starting point at around 2:30 PM. We opted for the 15km route, which was perfect for a leisurely afternoon on the water.

What sets this experience apart is the freedom it offers. There's no guide, so you can paddle at your own pace, take breaks whenever you want, and fully enjoy the scenery without any pressure. The trip took us about four hours, and we finished at around 6:30 PM. The same woman picked us up promptly and brought us back to our hotel, making the entire experience seamless and stress-free.

The price is unbeatable compared to other places. For just 600 baht, we got four hours on the water, transportation, life vests, and excellent service. If you're seeking a relaxed, affordable, and flexible kayaking adventure, this is definitely the place to go. Highly recommended!

We had the best time doing the 7km paddle down the river Kwai, it was stunning with so many things to see of the river banks.

Absolutely love the owner Fon, so fun and friendly, took lovely photos of us before we set off and dropped us back to our accommodation when we finished.

10/10 would recommend.

However if it's really hot, there's not many places to stop with shade, so bring plenty of water, a hat and a careful attribute.

'Extraordinary Experience Moments'
Celebrating Songkran in a distinctive way by kayaking on the renowned River Kwai in Kanchanaburi was incredible. We embarked on a 15km independent kayak journey without any guides, opting to navigate it ourselves.

Our adventure began when Khun Fon picked us up from our accommodation and drove us to the starting point, located 15km from the city. After a brief lesson from Khun Fon, assuring us that “we can do it,” we set off with bottles of water. We were advised to stay in the middle and avoid areas near shanties with open spaces underneath. The scenery was breathtaking, filled with fish and birds, allowing us to feel closely connected to nature. We were reminded of the beauty and tranquility that nature offers.

Although the weather was overcast and we experienced three rain showers, these added an element of excitement to our journey.The water current was gentle, which meant we had to paddle consistently for the duration of the trip. We started at 0949 and finished just before 1300.

Since there are no landmarks at the endpoint, remember to look out for four bridges along the way. The first bridge signals that you're nearing the city. The second one is the famous River Kwai bridge, followed by the third bridge just 700 meters later. The endpoint is at a Chinese temple on the left side, close to the fourth bridge. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to explore the temple as rain was approaching again.

For attire, be prepared to get wet from splashes while paddling, regardless of the weather. I wore lightweight leggings paired with shorts, a shirt, and a hat to protect myself from the sun, which also helped keep my hair dry during the rain. I brought a waterproof bag to keep my belongings safe and made sure to wear the life vest throughout the trip for safety. It's crucial to stay in the boat since the moving water could sweep you away.

We had previously kayaked 7km last year, which was a bit intimidating at first due to the river's width and being on our own. The sense of freedom and accomplishment as we paddled through the serene waters was unmatched.

Khun Fon and Mook, her daughter, were wonderful hosts-enthusiastic and welcoming. They provided high-quality equipment and refreshments and were punctual with pick-ups and drop-offs. They even captured moments with photos before and after our adventure. If you're seeking a unique river experience without the constraints of heat and rain, these are the people to turn to. It's genuinely worthwhile as you create lasting memories along the way.
Thank you, Khun Fon!

Conquering the river turned out to be the highlight of our holiday.

places.address: 11 River Kwai Rd, Tha Ma Kham, Mueang Kanchanaburi District, Kanchanaburi 71000, Thailand
